It is characterized by its finely divided, pinnately arranged fronds that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures called sporangia on the underside of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
